setup.description: Zowe setup configurations used by "zwe install" and "zwe init" commands.

prefix.description: Where Zowe MVS data sets will be installed

proclib.description: PROCLIB where Zowe STCs will be copied over

parmlibMembers.description: Holds Zowe PARMLIB members for plugins

jcllib.description: JCL library where Zowe will store temporary JCLs during initialization

loadlib.description: States the dataset where Zowe executable utilities are located

authLoadlib.description: The dataset that contains any Zowe core code that needs to run APF-authorized, such as ZIS

authPluginLib.description: APF authorized LOADLIB for Zowe ZIS Plugins

zis.description: ZIS related configurations. This setup is optional.

parmlib.description: ZIS related PARMLIB configurations. This setup is optional.

keys.description: Used to specify special ZIS key types with key-value pairs

security.description: Security related configurations. This setup is optional.

product.description: Security product name. Can be RACF, ACF2 or TSS

zowe.description: Zowe runtime user name of main service

zis.description: Zowe runtime user name of ZIS

name.description: Certificate alias name. Note: please use all lower cases as alias.

caAlias.description: Alias name of self-signed certificate authority. Note: please use all lower cases as alias.

caPassword.description: Password of keystore stored self-signed certificate authority.

lock.description: Whether to restrict the permissions of the keystore after creation

import.description: Configure this section if you want to import certificate from another PKCS#12 keystore.

keystore.description: Existing PKCS#12 keystore which holds the certificate issued by external CA.

alias.description: Certificate alias will be imported. Note: please use all lower cases as alias.

keyring.description: Configure this section if you are using z/OS keyring

owner.description: keyring owner. If this is empty, Zowe will use the user ID defined as zowe.setup.security.users.zowe.

connect.description: Configure this section if you want to connect existing certificate in keyring to Zowe.

user.description: Current owner of the existing certificate, can be SITE or an user ID.

label.description: Label of the existing certificate will be connected to Zowe keyring.

import.description: Configure this section if you want to import existing certificate stored in data set to Zowe.

dsName.description: Name of the data set holds the certificate issued by other CA. This data set should be in PKCS12 format and contain private key.

password.description: Password for the PKCS12 data set.

zOSMF.description: Configure this section if you want to trust z/OSMF certificate authority in Zowe keyring.

user.description: z/OSMF user. Zowe initialization utility can detect alias of z/OSMF CA for RACF security system. The automated detection requires this z/OSMF user as input.

caCommonName.description: Common name of certificate authority generated by Zowe.

commonName.description: Common name of certificate generated by Zowe.

orgUnit.description: Organization unit of certificate generated by Zowe.

org.description: Organization of certificate generated by Zowe.

locality.description: Locality of certificate generated by Zowe. This is usually the city name.

state.description: State of certificate generated by Zowe. You can also put province name here.

country.description: 2 letters country code of certificate generated by Zowe.

validity.description: Validity days for Zowe generated certificates

san.description: Domain names and IPs should be added into certificate SAN. If this field is not defined, `zwe init` command will use `zowe.externalDomains`.

importCertificateAuthorities.description: PEM format certificate authorities will also be imported and trusted. If you have other certificate authorities want to be trusted in Zowe keyring, list the certificate labels here. **NOTE**, due to the limitation of RACDCERT command, this field should contain maximum 2 entries.

vsam.description: VSAM configurations if you are using VSAM as Caching Service storage

mode.description: VSAM data set with Record-Level-Sharing enabled or not

volume.description: Volume name if you are using VSAM in NONRLS mode

storageClass.description: Storage class name if you are using VSAM in RLS mode

runtimeDirectory.description: Path to where you installed Zowe.

logDirectory.description: Path to where you want to store Zowe log files.

workspaceDirectory.description: Path to where you want to store Zowe workspace files. Zowe workspace are used by Zowe component runtime to store temporary files.

extensionDirectory.description: Path to where you want to store Zowe extensions. "zwe components install" will install new extensions into this directory.

job.description: Customize your Zowe z/OS JES job.

name.description: Job name of Zowe primary ZWESLSTC started task.

prefix.description: A short prefix to customize address spaces created by Zowe job.

vipaIp.description: The IP address which all of the Zowe servers will be binding to. If you are using multiple DIPVA addresses, do not use this option.

validatePortFree.description: Whether or not to ensure that the port a server is about to use is available. Usually, servers will know this when they attempt to bind to a port, so this option allows you to disable the additional verification step.

extensionRegistry.description: Defines optional configuration for downloading extensions from an online or offline registry

defaultHandler.description: The name of a handler specified in the handlers section. Will be used as the default for 'zwe components' commands

launcher.description: Set default behaviors of how the Zowe launcher will handle components

restartIntervals.description: Intervals of seconds to wait before restarting a component if it fails before the minUptime value.

minUptime.description: The minimum amount of seconds before a component is considered running and the restart counter is reset.

shareAs.description: Determines which SHAREAS mode should be used when starting a component

unsafeDisableZosVersionCheck.description: Used to allow Zowe to warn, instead of error, when running on a version of zOS that this version of Zowe hasn't been verified as working with

rbacProfileIdentifier.description: An ID used for determining resource names used in RBAC authorization checks

cookieIdentifier.description: An ID that can be used by servers that distinguish their cookies from unrelated Zowe installs

externalDomains.description: List of domain names of how you access Zowe from your local computer.

externalPort.description: Port number of how you access Zowe APIML Gateway from your local computer.

environments.description: Global environment variables can be applied to all Zowe high availability instances.

launchScript.description: Customize Zowe launch scripts (zwe commands) behavior.

logLevel.description: Log level for Zowe launch scripts.

onComponentConfigureFail.description: Chooses how 'zwe start' behaves if a component configure script fails

verifyCertificates.description: Customize how Zowe should validate certificates used by components or other services.

useConfigmgr.description: Determines whether or not to use the features of configmgr such as multi-config, parmlib config, config templates, and schema validation. This effects the zwe command.

configmgr.description: Controls how configmgr will be used by zwe

validation.description: States how configmgr will do validation: Will it quit on any error (STRICT) or quit on any error except the case of a component not having a schema file (COMPONENT-COMPAT)

host.description: Host or domain name of your z/OSMF instance.

port.description: Port number of your z/OSMF instance.

applId.description: Appl ID of your z/OSMF instance.

^.*$.description: Configuration of Zowe high availability instance.

hostname.description: Host name of the Zowe high availability instance. This is hostname for internal communications.

sysname.description: z/OS system name of the Zowe high availability instance. Some JES command will be routed to this system name.

alias.description: Certificate alias name of defined in your PKCS#12 keystore

key.description: Path to the certificate private key stored in PEM format.

certificate.description: Path to the certificate stored in PEM format.

certificateAuthorities.description: List of paths to the certificate authorities stored in PEM format.

oneOf.description: Paths to the certificate authorities stored in PEM format. You can separate multiple certificate authorities by comma.
Path to the certificate authority stored in PEM format.

file.description: Path of your z/OS keyring, including ring owner and ring name. Case sensitivity and spaces matter.

password.description: Literally 'password' may be needed when using keyrings for compatibility with java servers.

alias.description: Certificate label of z/OS keyring. Case sensitivity and spaces matter.

file.description: Path of your z/OS keyring, including ring owner and ring name. Case sensitivity and spaces matter.

password.description: Literally 'password' may be needed when using keyrings for compatibility with java servers.

key.description: Path to the certificate private key stored in PEM format.

certificate.description: Path to the certificate stored in PEM format.

certificateAuthorities.description: List of paths to the certificate authorities stored in PEM format.

oneOf.description: Paths to the certificate authorities stored in PEM format. You can separate multiple certificate authorities by comma.
Path to the certificate authority stored in PEM format.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable this component

launcher.description: Set behavior of how the Zowe launcher will handle this particular component

restartIntervals.description: Intervals of seconds to wait before restarting a component if it fails before the minUptime value.

minUptime.description: The minimum amount of seconds before a component is considered running and the restart counter is reset.

shareAs.description: Determines which SHAREAS mode should be used when starting a component

registry.description: The location of the default registry for this handler. It could be a URL, path, dataset, whatever this handler supports

path.description: Unix file path to the configmgr-compatible JS file which implements the handler API
